title: Ticket #5067: Failure to get remote address
description:
A user of ours was experiencing an issue with 'condor_ce_q' (with OSG's Condor 8.2.8 compiled without the NO_PHONE_HOME flag). His SchedLog has quite a few of the following errors: 

05/25/15 19:53:21 entering FileTransfer::SimpleInit
05/25/15 19:53:22 -------- Begin starting jobs --------
05/25/15 19:53:22 -------- Done starting jobs --------
05/25/15 19:53:22 condor_write(): Socket closed when trying to write 13 bytes to , fd is 20
05/25/15 19:53:22 Buf::write(): condor_write() failed
05/25/15 19:53:22 SharedPortEndpoint: failed to send final status (success) for SHARED_PORT_PASS_SOCK
05/25/15 19:53:22 PERMISSION DENIED to treydock@users.opensciencegrid.org from host 0 INVALID ADDRESS FAMILY
for command 1112 (QMGMT_WRITE_CMD), access level WRITE: reason: WRITE authorization policy contains no matching
ALLOW entry for this request; identifiers used for this host: , hostname size = 0, original ip address = 0
INVALID ADDRESS FAMILY
05/25/15 19:53:22 Clearing userlog file cache

And I'm not sure if it's related but there seem to be some other issues with the file transfer: 

05/25/15 19:27:20 ReliSock::get_file_with_permissions(): going to set permissions 644
05/25/15 19:27:21 get_file(): going to write to filename /fdata/spool/3004/0/cluster23004.proc0.subproc0.tmp/nagrun.sh
05/25/15 19:27:21 get_file: Receiving 13815 bytes
05/25/15 19:27:21 get_file: wrote 13815 bytes to file
05/25/15 19:27:21 rename(/fdata/spool/3003/0/cluster23003.proc0.subproc0.tmp/gridjob.tgz,
/fdata/spool/3003/0/cluster23003.proc0.subproc0/gridjob.tgz) failed with errno 2
05/25/15 19:27:21 ERROR "FileTransfer CommitFiles Failed -- What Now?!?!" at line 2564 in file
/builddir/build/BUILD/condor-8.2.8/src/condor_utils/file_transfer.cpp
05/25/15 19:27:21 ReliSock::get_file_with_permissions(): going to set permissions 755
05/25/15 19:27:21 Initializing Directory: curr_dir = /fdata/spool/3004/0/cluster23004.proc0.subproc0.tmp
remarks:
2015-May-26 21:35:48 by bbockelm:
Is there anything interesting in the SharedPortLog corresponding to the schedd failures?

The second (ENOENT) indicates either (from man 2 rename):

  1. The link named by oldpath does not exist
  2. A directory component in newpath does not exist

Honestly, the two look unrelated. I'd start with the first though. Suggestions:

  1. Are hostnames setup appropriately? (Includes reverse DNS).
  2. Did the user try setting ENABLE_IPV6=true in the configuration?
  3. Are there multiple hostnames being juggled? Does the external hostname differ from the output of the hostname command?

2015-May-27 09:10:07 by blin:
One thing to note is that when he downgrade to OSG's 8.2.8-2 package, he did not see these errors. It was only with 8.2.8-3, which was built without the NO_PHONE_HOME flag.

2015-May-28 17:41:11 by blin:
From the GOC ticket (https://ticket.opensciencegrid.org/25590):

  1. Reverse DNS looks fine
  2. He has 'ENABLE_IPV6=false'
  3. He does not have multiple hostnames

2015-Jun-05 13:03:45 by blin:
Alain, have you had a chance to look at this since we last spoke?

2015-Sep-28 14:54:56 by blin:
Trey says he hasn't seen this issue in a while so we can close this for the time being.
creator: blin
